page.title: 12College Farm
page.content: College farm is a 3OO year old 3OO acre mixed farm. The crops grown are barley, wheat and grass. British Fresian beef and dairy cattle are reared. E.E.C. membership has caused the farm to focus on dairying as market gardening became unprofitable. Mechanisation on the farm consists of three tractors, a plough, a disc harrow, a cultivator, a roller, a seed drill, a fertilizer spreader, a combine harvester, a hay trimmer, a double chopping mower and a bale carrier. The milk parlour is a 5/5 herring bone. The cows are milked twice a day and the Milk Marketing Board collects the milk every day. Great care is taken when applying fertilizer and pesticides to avoid river pollution and straw is only burnt on calm days.
